Fields.description: The base class fields that should exists in a table for this base class to be used

Extends.title: Extends
Extends.description:
If specified, the settings in this file extends settings in a base file similar to tsconfig.json
You can also use Sergen defaults by specifying this like "defaults@x.y.z"

RootNamespace.description: The root namespace for the target project. It is recommended to have this in sergen.json. If not there, it will be auto calculated from root namespace in CSPROJ file, or derived from project file name by removing .Web suffix. Generated code will be placed under this namespace and project's own types are assumed to be under this namespace as well

DeclareJoinConstants.description: If true, generated code will declare and use jFKTable type of constants for expressions in entities

EnableGenerateFields.description: If this is true, it allows the use of [GenerateFields] attributes on rows, which automatically generates the fields using a source generator. This should only be used when Serenity.Pro.Coder is enabled in the project

EnableRowTemplates.description: If true, enables RowTemplate class generation. This should only be used when Serenity.Pro.Coder is enabled in the project. Has no effect when EnableGenerateFields is true. EnableGenerateFields should be preferred over this as RowTemplate might cause some issues

EndOfLine.title: EndOfLine
EndOfLine.description: End of line character to use in generated files. If not specified, it will be auto detected from the environment. It is recommended to have "lf" for multi platform projects

FileScopedNamespaces.description: If true, generated code will use file scoped namespaces

ParseGlobalUsings.description: If true, generated code will parse global usings from the current project

IncludeGlobalUsings.description: If specified, generated code will assume these usings are in global using scope

ExcludeGlobalUsings.description: If specified, generated code will assume these usings are not in global using scope even if they are in global using scope

OmitDefaultSchema.description: If true, the default schema name, e.g. "dbo" for SQL Server won't be emitted in generated field expressions in Row.cs files. This is true by default only for MySql as in MySql schema names are actually database names

UseOriginAttribute.description: If true, instead of using [Expression] attributes for foreign view fields, it will use Origin(nameof(jFK), nameof(FKRow.ViewField)) if the FKRow is already generated in the project. It will also use ForeignKey(typeof(FKRow)) type of foreign keys instead of strings

SaveGeneratedTables.description: If true, generated table options like Identity, Module etc. will be saved to the Connections array in sergen.json after code generation. Default is true

ClientTypes.title: ClientTypes
ClientTypes.description: Client types code generation related configuration

OutDir.description: The output directory for generated client types .cs files

SourceGenerator.description: If false, the client types source generator in Serenity.Pro.Coder will be disabled

UseRootNamespace.description: If true, generated MVC views will be placed under the root namespace of the project

SearchViewPaths.description: View paths to search for, defaults to "Modules" and "Views". "ProjectName" is used instead of "Modules" if Razor SDK is used for the project, e.g. a Razor class library

StripViewPaths.description: Strip view paths from generated files. Defaults to "Modules", "Views". E.g. a subclass for Modules and Views won't be generated

SourceGenerator.description: If false, the view paths source generator in Serenity.Pro.Coder will be disabled

ServerTypings.title: ServerTypings
ServerTypings.description: Server typings code generation related configuration

Assemblies.description: Assemblies for server typings generation. Specify only if Sergen can't auto determine your project output file

OutDir.description: The output directory for generated server typings files. Not used for modules

LocalTexts.description: If true, local texts will be generated

ModuleReExports.description: If true, module re-exports will be generated. Defaults to true

ModuleTypings.description: If true, module typings will be generated. Defaults to true if you have "module" defined in tsconfig.json. Deprecated as only ES modules style code generation is supported now

NamespaceTypings.description: If true, namespace typings will be generated. Defaults to true if you don't have "module" defined in tsconfig.json. Deprecated as only ES modules style code generation is supported now

PreferRelativePaths.description: If true, generated typings will use relative paths instead of paths from tsconfig.json, e.g. "../ServerTypes/" instead of "@/ServerTypes/"

SourceGenerator.description: If false, the server typings source generator in Serenity.Pro.Coder will be disabled

Restore.title: Restore
Restore.description: Sergen restore command related configuration. Deprecated as Sergen no longer supports restoring static content

Include.description: List of files (git ignore like) to include while restoring

Exclude.description: List of files (git ignore like) to exclude while restoring

Typings.description: Set false to disable namespace typings restore to typings/ folder

EntryPoints.description: List of entry point globs, default is "Modules/**/*Page.ts", "Modules/**/*Page.tsx", "Modules/**/ScriptInit.ts"

SourceGenerator.description: Should the list of entry points, e.g. ESM be generated, only available with Serenity.Pro.Coder

Connections.title: Connections
Connections.description: List of connections. It is only needed when it is desired to work / generated code based on a connection string that is not in appsettings.json

KDiff3Path.description: Path to KDiff3 executable. If not specified, it will be auto detected from the environment. (deprecated)

TSCPath.description: Full path to TypeScript compiler. It is assumed to be in path if not specified. (deprecated)

BaseRowClasses.title: BaseRowClasses
BaseRowClasses.description: List of base row classes to be used instead of Row. They are matched by list of base properties

ForeignFieldSelection.title: ForeignFieldSelection
ForeignFieldSelection.description:
The set of foreign fields to generate, default is NameOnly.

None: Don't generate any foreign view fields except the ones explicitly included via IncludeForeignFields
All: Generate all the foreign view fields, except ones excluded explicitly via RemoveForeignFields
NameOnly: Don't generate any foreign view fields except the Name property of the target row and ones explicitly included via IncludeForeignFields

IncludeForeignFields.description: A list of foreign fields to include in generated code. This could be used to include some additional fields This could be used to include some additional fields. Not so useful if ForeignFieldSelection is All

RemoveForeignFields.description: A list of foreign fields to omit from generated code. This could be used to disable generating code for join fields like CreatedBy, ModifiedBy etc, so properties like CustomerCreatedBy, CustomerModifiedBy etc. won't be generated in OrderRow. Not so useful if ForeignFieldSelection is None or NameOnly

CustomTemplates.description:
The location of custom templates folder. The files in this folder will override the default scriban templates in Sergen. You may also include additional files to be generated. Their names must match the names at 
https://github.com/serenity-is/Serenity/tree/master/src/Serenity.Net.CodeGenerator/Templates 
You may also include additional files to be generated

CustomGenerate.title: CustomGenerate
CustomGenerate.description: The relative paths of custom generated files

CustomSettings.title: CustomSettings
CustomSettings.description: Custom settings to be passed to and used in custom templates

AppSettingFiles.description: The list of appsettings.json files in order. Default is appsettings.json, appsettings.machine.json

UpgradeInfo.title: UpgradeInfo
UpgradeInfo.description: The upgrade / migration related information used by stargen to determine the base version of template used, and already applied upgrades

InitialType.title: InitialType
InitialType.description: Initial type of project. Available options are "Community" e.g. Serene, "Premium" e.g. StartSharp

InitialVersion.description: Version this project is created from. Used to determine which migrations should be applied to project (starting from)
InitialVersion.title: InitialVersion

AppliedUpgrades.title: AppliedUpgrades
AppliedUpgrades.description: List of already applied upgrades if any
